Political Philosophy.description: Natural law, virtue ethics, and classical liberal thought from ancient Greece to modern libertarianism

Economics.description: The evolution of economic thought from Adam Smith through classical and Austrian schools

Alchemy.description: The alchemical tradition from Arabic sources through Paracelsian medicine to Rosicrucian philosophy

Renaissance.description: The Florentine Renaissance: Neoplatonism, Christian Kabbalah, and humanist scholarship

Byzantine.description: Greek patristics, Byzantine mysticism, and Eastern Christian spirituality

Scientific Revolution.description: From Copernicus to Newton: the birth of modern science through experiment and mathematics

Comparative Esoteric.description: Parallel esoteric traditions: Taoist alchemy, Sanskrit Tantra, Kabbalah, and Chinese philosophy

Ancient Texts.description: Non-canonical ancient texts: pseudepigrapha, Gnostic scriptures, and Dead Sea Scrolls

Court Culture.description: The brilliant confluence of alchemy and astronomy at Rudolf II's Prague court

Medieval Mysticism.description: Western medieval mysticism from Rhineland Germany to Flemish and English contemplative traditions

Modern Occultism.description: Late 19th-early 20th century occult revival: Theosophy, Anthroposophy, Golden Dawn, Thelema

Islamic Tradition.description: Islamic philosophy and Sufism from al-Ghazali to Ibn Arabi

Philosophy.description: Comparative philosophy of mind and Cambridge Platonism

Medicine & Science.description: Ancient and medieval medicine from Galen to the medical revolution

Medieval Art.description: Insular manuscript illumination from Celtic Britain and Ireland

Mathematics.description: Euler and the mathematical foundations of the Enlightenment

usage.forLLMs: Load this index to browse all collections, then fetch specific collection JSON files. Collections now comprehensive with 5-25 books each from all curator sessions.
usage.forFrontend: Build collection browse/search UI with category filters. Collections ordered by displayOrder for optimal presentation.
usage.forResearchers: 36 thematically coherent collections spanning Western esotericism, philosophy, science, and comparative traditions.

changes: Expanded existing collections with books from sessions 017-026

Added 11 new collections: Medieval Mysticism, Modern Occultism, Chinese Classics, Scientific Revolution Core, Islamic Philosophy, Comparative Philosophy of Mind, Ancient Medicine, Insular Gospels, Euler Mathematics, Natural Magic, Cambridge Platonism
Nearly doubled total book count while maintaining thematic coherence
